archetype_name: Family Hands-Off Sheet Pan & Slow Cooker Nights
name: Sheet-Pan Za'atar Salmon with Courgette & Tomatoes and Lemon Couscous
description: Hands-off roasted salmon and vegetables with bright Mediterranean flavors, paired with quick lemon couscous. Minimal prep, family-friendly, and no chili heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a large sheet pan with parchment.
Slice courgette into half-moons and red onion into wedges.
Rinse cherry tomatoes and pat dry.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, za'atar, sumac, minced garlic, lemon zest, salt, and black pepper.
Pat salmon dry with paper towels.
Bring water to a boil in a small pot for couscous.
Roughly chop parsley and cut lemon in half for juicing.
cook_steps: Toss courgette, cherry tomatoes, and red onion with half of the za'atar oil. Spread on the sheet pan in a single layer.
Roast vegetables for 15 minutes on the middle rack.
Remove pan, make space, and place salmon on the pan. Brush salmon with the remaining za'atar oil.
Return pan to oven and roast 10–12 minutes, until salmon flakes and vegetables are tender.
While salmon roasts, add couscous to a heatproof bowl. Pour boiling water over, cover, and let stand 5 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork. Stir in chopped parsley, lemon juice (to taste), and a drizzle of olive oil. Adjust salt if needed.
Scatter olives over the roasted vegetables, then serve salmon with the veg and lemon couscous.
